name: df-inito
params: setvar s0, setvar s1, setvar s2, setvar s3
body: |- wceq(cinito, cmpt(s0, ccat, crab(s1, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), wral(s2, cfv(cbs, cv(s0)), weu(s3, wcel(cv(s3), co(cv(s1), cfv(chom, cv(s0)), cv(s2))))))))
comment: An object A is said to be an initial object provided that for each object B there is exactly one morphism from A to B. Definition 7.1 in [Adamek] p. 101, or definition in [Lang] p. 57 (called "a universally repelling object" there). (Contributed by AV, 3-Apr-2020.)
